<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The bigger question is...should we ever go back to a 162-game season? </p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ANTITRUST
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/09/28/apple-vs-epic-legal-fight-began-monday?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Epic Battle for the Digital Economy Has Begun
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Fortnite GIF" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=377 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/H6z1QKPz8wVliLqUQY/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Fortnite GIF" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/H6z1QKPz8wVliLqUQY/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">At a court hearing yesterday, Apple and Epic Games <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/09/25/tech/apple-fortnite-epic-games-lawsuit/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">kicked off</a> the most controversial debate over apps since we ordered mussels in North Dakota. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>In August, <em>Fortnite </em>maker Epic launched <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/13/legal-battle-breaks-fortnite-owner-apple?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">an attack</a> against Apple that will go down as the Lexington and Concord of this revolution. It introduced a feature that sidestepped Apple's 30% cut on in-app purchases, knowing that Apple would pull <em>Fortnite</em> from its App Store for breaking the rules. Then came a flurry of lawsuits. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That removal was the subject of yesterday's hearing, but the judge is <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-09-26/apple-s-battle-royale-with-epic-games-starts-for-real-this-week?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">not expected</a> to reinstate <em>Fortnite </em>in the App Store, according to Bloomberg.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Why it matters </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">When you think about "monopolies," you probably conjure up images of industrial barons like Andrew Carnegie and John D. Rockefeller. Today's version of that, critics say, is Apple's App Store, a critical gateway to the digital economy that charges George Washington Bridge-like tolls for access. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The rebuttal:</strong> Apple says it does a lot of <a href="https://www.cnet.com/news/apples-battle-with-epic-games-could-lead-to-big-changes-in-iphone-apps/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">dirty work</a>, like vetting apps for privacy and security issues, and its fees reflect the services it provides to developers and consumers. Apple has knocked Epic as a "multibillion-dollar enterprise that simply wants to pay nothing for the tremendous value it derives from the App Store."  </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Google has entered the chat</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Google's not the Evil Empire in this drama, but it hasn't exactly been Switzerland, either. It also charges a 30% cut of in-app purchases, booted <em>Fortnite </em>off its app marketplace, and faces a lawsuit from Epic Games.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, Google released updates meant to fend off growing antitrust concerns, most notably that the next version of its operating system, Android 12, will <a href="https://venturebeat.com/2020/09/28/google-epic-response-android-12-app-stores/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">make it easier</a> for users to access third-party app stores (Apple can't say this because the App Store is the <em>only</em> app store available on iPhones).</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Whatever the outcome—and it could take years to resolve—the Epic v. Apple battle shows how app stores have morphed from a small icon on your phone into some of the world's most important marketplaces.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
RETAIL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/09/28/amazon-prime-day-will-kick-off-extended-holiday-shopping-period-oct-1314?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Amazon Invades Halloween's Turf
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="A box filled with cash for Amazon Prime Day" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xMDY3L2FtYXpvbl9wcmltZV9kYXlfYm94LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Prepare to be bombarded by friends showing off their Instant Pots. Amazon confirmed yesterday that its famous mega-sale, <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/09/28/cnn-underscored/amazon-prime-day-2020/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Prime Day</a>, will be held Oct. 13–14. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Like most businesses,</strong> Amazon had to reshuffle its calendar due to Covid, pushing back Prime Day from its typical July date. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Unlike most businesses</strong>, the delay arose partly because Amazon was doing <em>too</em> well, and it couldn’t handle a further uptick in demand during the summer. The retailer is <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/amazons-late-prime-day-now-in-october-set-to-fuel-record-end-to-year-11601269260?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">on pace</a> to smash the $280.5 billion it did in sales last year.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The holiday experiment</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Prime Day isn’t just Amazon’s day anymore—last year, an entire ecosystem of 250+ retailers offered their own discounts around the event to leverage Bezos’s star power. Now, a Prime Day in October means Amazon is <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2020/09/28/amazons-prime-day-mega-sale-event-will-take-place-october-13-14/?guccounter=1&guce_referrer=aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuZ29vZ2xlLmNvbS8&guce_referrer_sig=AQAAADxVTggVxciSKogl3Id7_vMhbxZcKnHeYHE_rZB0uD_FtXQTF4ziKib4_VgJ8x4Fqk6KrXunQXQ_wFMYKO9UKPTdH9nbm4k-H6-J27dolf9EZxm7gZ0UCupFvRqgsMadYt1e3WndX8N7470_XEGEJGlTW-uBzvv5exlAgOdS4_Ym&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">pushing up</a> the holiday shopping period for the entire industry. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Amazon is also trying to make friends with the third-party sellers that use its marketplace. During the first day of the sale, Amazon is giving Prime members a $10 credit if they spend money on items sold by select small businesses on the site. </p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
AGRICULTURE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/09/28/wine-country-siege-fires?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Napa Cab Sav Under Siege
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Fire in wine country " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yNTQ4L2ZpcmVfaW5fd2luZV9jb3VudHJ5LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>SAMUEL CORUM/AFP via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On Monday, a trio of fast-moving wildfires known as the "Glass Incident" <a href="https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/nation/2020/09/28/california-wildfires-glass-fire-zogg-fire-wine-country-evacuations/3559145001/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">engulfed</a> California's Napa-Sonoma region, forcing sudden evacuations and putting over 8,500 structures at risk—including the area's famed wineries. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Talk about bad timing</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The fires <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/usa-wildfires/california-wine-country-wildfire-forces-evacuation-of-hospital-hundreds-of-homes-idINKBN26J05F?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">hit Napa</a> halfway through the grape harvesting season. While grapes for white wine and rosé were mostly picked, red wine (Napa's most famous export) could be impacted. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Vintners were already concerned. </strong>Weeks of fires across the West Coast have dramatically worsened air quality, which could taint grapes still on the vine. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>California's Wine Institute association </span><span><a href="https://www.foxnews.com/food-drink/california-wineries-wildfires-smoky-wines?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">says</a></span><span> smoke exposure is only a concern for grapes near the blazes... </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>But one winemaker has already </span><span><a href="https://apnews.com/article/virus-outbreak-wildfires-oregon-fires-wineries-ecead6f181c11c6110f017c9af8e63a2?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">complained</a></span><span> of "ashy, barbecued flavor.”</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>These fires are "without question the single worst disaster the wine-grape growing community has ever faced," California Association of Winegrape Growers President John Aguirre said. The state's wine industry employs 30,000+ people, and the fires could have ripple effects on hotels, rentals, and tourism. </p>

</h1>

</tr>
</table>
<img alt="housing market " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xMDYvaG91c2luZ19tYXJrZXQuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Last year, the median wealth of a typical white family ($188,200) was 5x that of a typical Hispanic family and 8x that of a typical Black family, according to the Federal Reserve’s latest* <a href="https://www.federalreserve.gov/publications/files/scf20.pdf?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Survey of Consumer Finance</a>. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>*Latest = 2019...at the peak of the economic expansion and before the pandemic disproportionately affected workers of color and those with less formal education. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">While Americans’ median net worth <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/09/28/business/economy/coronavirus-pandemic-income-inequality.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">rose</a> 18% and median family income gained 5% from 2016–2019, slightly narrowing the income distribution, America’s cavernous wealth gap has persisted on many fronts:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Before the current recession, the typical white family had $50,600 worth of equities they could tap in an emergency; typical Black and Hispanic families had <$15,000.</span></li>
</ul>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>While 70% of upper-middle income folks held stocks (and benefitted from this summer’s rally), only 31% of families in the bottom half did. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Two-thirds of working-age families had a retirement plan last year, a smaller proportion than in 2016. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Many economists fear that families who were struggling financially before Covid-19 will come out of the pandemic in worse shape. </p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MUSIC
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/09/28/record-stock-listing-kpop-band-btss-record-label?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Let’s Play a Game
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A company is going public soon. We’ll give you three hints, and you have to guess the company we’re describing. </p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>It raked in $500 million in revenue last year.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>It derived </span><span><a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/09/28/investing/bts-big-hit-entertainment-ipo/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">97% of that revenue</a></span><span> from just seven people <img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/purple-heart_1f49c.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt="">.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>It’s successfully made the jump from Korea into Western culture.</span></li>
</ol>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If you answered “Big Hit Entertainment, the Korean record label of K-pop boy band BTS,” then you must have a very specific Spotify history.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Big Hit’s upcoming public offering is already the biggest South Korean stock market listing in the last three years. And 98% of the ~1,420 institutional investors participating in the offering have said they would pay the <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-bts-big-hit-ipo/investors-swamp-ipo-for-k-pop-band-bts-management-label-prices-at-top-of-range-idUSKBN26J09S?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">top-range IPO price</a> or higher.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>At $115/share, the company would be valued at $4.1 billion, turning all seven members of BTS, who are shareholders in Big Hit, into multimillionaires.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>A publicly traded company has never had as rabid a fanbase as BTS’s supporters, known as ARMY. Expect retail investors to come out in droves when Big Hit makes its trading debut on Oct. 15. </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FROM THE CREW
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Marketing and Finance Resources That Won't Put You to Sleep
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

</table>
<img alt="Marketing Brew stock image" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yNDIyL21hcmtldGluZ19icmV3X3N0b2NrX2ltYWdlLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Over the past few weeks, the Brew has rolled out the first two editions in our Syllabus Series: <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/09/16/marketing-beginners-best-articles-expert-resources?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Marketing 101</a> and <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/09/23/finance-beginners-best-articles-expert-resources?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Finance 101</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What is the Syllabus Series? </strong>We’ve reimagined the concept of the syllabus, dropping boring articles from the 1960s and adding videos, podcasts, and our favorite social media personalities to help you get a 101-level understanding of complex business topics. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Who’s it for? </strong>Anyone, really, but especially a) people who work in these industries day-to-day but want a broader view or b) people who don’t work in these fields <em>yet</em> but are interested in dipping a toe in to see what they're all about. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Check them out here:</strong> <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/09/16/marketing-beginners-best-articles-expert-resources?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Marketing 101</a> // <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/09/23/finance-beginners-best-articles-expert-resources?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Finance 101</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Stay tuned for more in the coming weeks. Any suggestions?</p>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Five stock picks that we think could make you rich </strong>are in this <a href="https://www.fool.com/ecap/stock-advisor/sa-5-stocks-under-50-a-covid/?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=contentmarketing&utm_campaign=5stocksunder50-50dollars&aid=9394&paid=9394&waid=9394&source=esamnbwdg0210094&psource=esamnbwdg0210094&wsource=esamnbwdg0210094&testId=e-sa-5-stocks-under-50&cellId=3&campaign=sa-5-free-stocks-under-50" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">article</a>. That took 14 words. Yet we’ve got space for 35. So here’s a joke about turtles: Every time turtles go out, it’s a bar crawl. Ok, <a href="https://www.fool.com/ecap/stock-advisor/sa-5-stocks-under-50-a-covid/?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=contentmarketing&utm_campaign=5stocksunder50-50dollars&aid=9394&paid=9394&waid=9394&source=esamnbwdg0210094&psource=esamnbwdg0210094&wsource=esamnbwdg0210094&testId=e-sa-5-stocks-under-50&cellId=3&campaign=sa-5-free-stocks-under-50" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sign up here for the five stock picks</a>.*</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">We’re taking this cereal giveaway very cereal-ously</strong>. To celebrate the most important of holidays, National Coffee Day, <em>and</em> the release of the <a href="https://woobox.com/4nvvnw" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">new coffee-inspired Dunkin’™ Cereals</a>, we’re giving some lucky Brew readers a chance to win a free box. <a href="https://woobox.com/4nvvnw" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Get the details here</a>.*</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Tech Tip Tuesday:</strong> You can watch the first presidential debate tonight on <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9HnKFUNlcfY" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">CBS</a>, <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wW1lY5jFNcQ" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">C-SPAN</a>, and <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KdJ8SDOFrdw" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">ABC News</a>’s YouTube channels or through streaming apps on Apple TV, Roku, Xbox One, etc. Hardware hack: Getting a cheap TV antenna lets you watch events like this one without buying cable. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Elon Musk: </strong>on a podcast. Talking AI. With legendary journalist Kara Swisher. <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/09/28/opinion/sway-kara-swisher-elon-musk.html" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">You know you wanna listen</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Three infographics about coffee for National Coffee Day:</strong> 1) How to brew a <a href="https://www.dailyinfographic.com/how-to-make-the-perfect-cup-of-coffee-using-the-pour-over-method" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">perfect pour-over</a> cup 2) all about <a href="https://www.dailyinfographic.com/the-baristas-guide-to-latte-art" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">latte art</a> and 3) egg yolks, lemon juice, and <a href="https://www.dailyinfographic.com/coffee-countries" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">other ways</a> different countries dress up their coffee.</p>

style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eMarkets: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eStocks may not be having a good September, but it's all about how you close. The major indexes posted \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/09/27/stock-market-futures-open-to-close-news.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebig gains\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e yesterday amid rumbles of compromise on a relief bill and good economic news out of China.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e2020: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003ePresident Trump and Joe Biden will trade jabs (but not \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.foxnews.com/politics/no-handshakes-between-biden-and-trump-at-first-debate?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehandshakes\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e) in the first presidential debate at 9pm ET tonight. Fox News's Chris Wallace will moderate from the venue in Cleveland, OH.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003c!-- END MARKETS --\u003e\n\u003c!-- ARTICLE ---\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"c6 \" style=\"margin-bottom:7px\"\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003cth class=\"card\" style=\"text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px\"\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding: 15px;\"\u003e\n\u003ch3 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nANTITRUST \n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/09/28/apple-vs-epic-legal-fight-began-monday?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nThe Epic Battle for the Digital Economy Has Begun\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if mso]\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Fortnite GIF\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" height=377 src=\"https://media.giphy.com/media/H6z1QKPz8wVliLqUQY/giphy.gif\"\u003e\n\u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso]\u003e--\u003e\u003c!-- --\u003e\n\u003cimg class=\"story-header-image\" alt=\"Fortnite GIF\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" src=\"https://media.giphy.com/media/H6z1QKPz8wVliLqUQY/giphy.gif\"\u003e\n\u003c!--\u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eGiphy\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAt a court hearing yesterday, Apple and Epic Games \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/09/25/tech/apple-fortnite-epic-games-lawsuit/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ekicked off\u003c/a\u003e the most controversial debate over apps since we ordered mussels in North Dakota. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003eIn August, \u003cem\u003eFortnite \u003c/em\u003emaker Epic launched \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/13/legal-battle-breaks-fortnite-owner-apple?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ean attack\u003c/a\u003e against Apple that will go down as the Lexington and Concord of this revolution. It introduced a feature that sidestepped Apple's 30% cut on in-app purchases, knowing that Apple would pull \u003cem\u003eFortnite\u003c/em\u003e from its App Store for breaking the rules. Then came a flurry of lawsuits. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThat removal was the subject of yesterday's hearing, but the judge is \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-09-26/apple-s-battle-royale-with-epic-games-starts-for-real-this-week?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enot expected\u003c/a\u003e to reinstate \u003cem\u003eFortnite \u003c/em\u003ein the App Store, according to Bloomberg.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhy it matters \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhen you think about \"monopolies,\" you probably conjure up images of industrial barons like Andrew Carnegie and John D. Rockefeller. Today's version of that, critics say, is Apple's App Store, a critical gateway to the digital economy that charges George Washington Bridge-like tolls for access. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe rebuttal:\u003c/strong\u003e Apple says it does a lot of \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnet.com/news/apples-battle-with-epic-games-could-lead-to-big-changes-in-iphone-apps/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edirty work\u003c/a\u003e, like vetting apps for privacy and security issues, and its fees reflect the services it provides to developers and consumers. Apple has knocked Epic as a \"multibillion-dollar enterprise that simply wants to pay nothing for the tremendous value it derives from the App Store.\"  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eGoogle has entered the chat\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eGoogle's not the Evil Empire in this drama, but it hasn't exactly been Switzerland, either. It also charges a 30% cut of in-app purchases, booted \u003cem\u003eFortnite \u003c/em\u003eoff its app marketplace, and faces a lawsuit from Epic Games.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, Google released updates meant to fend off growing antitrust concerns, most notably that the next version of its operating system, Android 12, will \u003ca href=\"https://venturebeat.com/2020/09/28/google-epic-response-android-12-app-stores/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emake it easier\u003c/a\u003e for users to access third-party app stores (Apple can't say this because the App Store is the \u003cem\u003eonly\u003c/em\u003e app store available on iPhones).\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eWhatever the outcome—and it could take years to resolve—the Epic v. Apple battle shows how app stores have morphed from a small icon on your phone into some of the world's most important marketplaces.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003ePrepare to be bombarded by friends showing off their Instant Pots. Amazon confirmed yesterday that its famous mega-sale, \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/09/28/cnn-underscored/amazon-prime-day-2020/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ePrime Day\u003c/a\u003e, will be held Oct. 13–14. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLike most businesses,\u003c/strong\u003e Amazon had to reshuffle its calendar due to Covid, pushing back Prime Day from its typical July date. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eUnlike most businesses\u003c/strong\u003e, the delay arose partly because Amazon was doing \u003cem\u003etoo\u003c/em\u003e well, and it couldn’t handle a further uptick in demand during the summer. The retailer is \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/amazons-late-prime-day-now-in-october-set-to-fuel-record-end-to-year-11601269260?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eon pace\u003c/a\u003e to smash the $280.5 billion it did in sales last year.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe holiday experiment\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003ePrime Day isn’t just Amazon’s day anymore—last year, an entire ecosystem of 250+ retailers offered their own discounts around the event to leverage Bezos’s star power. Now, a Prime Day in October means Amazon is \u003ca href=\"https://techcrunch.com/2020/09/28/amazons-prime-day-mega-sale-event-will-take-place-october-13-14/?guccounter=1\u0026guce_referrer=aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuZ29vZ2xlLmNvbS8\u0026guce_referrer_sig=AQAAADxVTggVxciSKogl3Id7_vMhbxZcKnHeYHE_rZB0uD_FtXQTF4ziKib4_VgJ8x4Fqk6KrXunQXQ_wFMYKO9UKPTdH9nbm4k-H6-J27dolf9EZxm7gZ0UCupFvRqgsMadYt1e3WndX8N7470_XEGEJGlTW-uBzvv5exlAgOdS4_Ym\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epushing up\u003c/a\u003e the holiday shopping period for the entire industry. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAmazon is also trying to make friends with the third-party sellers that use its marketplace. During the first day of the sale, Amazon is giving Prime members a $10 credit if they spend money on items sold by select small businesses on the site. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOn Monday, a trio of fast-moving wildfires known as the \"Glass Incident\" \u003ca href=\"https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/nation/2020/09/28/california-wildfires-glass-fire-zogg-fire-wine-country-evacuations/3559145001/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eengulfed\u003c/a\u003e California's Napa-Sonoma region, forcing sudden evacuations and putting over 8,500 structures at risk—including the area's famed wineries. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eTalk about bad timing\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe fires \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/usa-wildfires/california-wine-country-wildfire-forces-evacuation-of-hospital-hundreds-of-homes-idINKBN26J05F?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehit Napa\u003c/a\u003e halfway through the grape harvesting season. While grapes for white wine and rosé were mostly picked, red wine (Napa's most famous export) could be impacted. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eVintners were already concerned. \u003c/strong\u003eWeeks of fires across the West Coast have dramatically worsened air quality, which could taint grapes still on the vine. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eCalifornia's Wine Institute association \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.foxnews.com/food-drink/california-wineries-wildfires-smoky-wines?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esays\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e smoke exposure is only a concern for grapes near the blazes... \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eBut one winemaker has already \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/virus-outbreak-wildfires-oregon-fires-wineries-ecead6f181c11c6110f017c9af8e63a2?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecomplained\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e of \"ashy, barbecued flavor.”\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eThese fires are \"without question the single worst disaster the wine-grape growing community has ever faced,\" California Association of Winegrape Growers President John Aguirre said. The state's wine industry employs 30,000+ people, and the fires could have ripple effects on hotels, rentals, and tourism. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLast year, the median wealth of a typical white family ($188,200) was 5x that of a typical Hispanic family and 8x that of a typical Black family, according to the Federal Reserve’s latest* \u003ca href=\"https://www.federalreserve.gov/publications/files/scf20.pdf?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eSurvey of Consumer Finance\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e*Latest = 2019...at the peak of the economic expansion and before the pandemic disproportionately affected workers of color and those with less formal education. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhile Americans’ median net worth \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/09/28/business/economy/coronavirus-pandemic-income-inequality.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erose\u003c/a\u003e 18% and median family income gained 5% from 2016–2019, slightly narrowing the income distribution, America’s cavernous wealth gap has persisted on many fronts:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBefore the current recession, the typical white family had $50,600 worth of equities they could tap in an emergency; typical Black and Hispanic families had \u003c$15,000.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWhile 70% of upper-middle income folks held stocks (and benefitted from this summer’s rally), only 31% of families in the bottom half did. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eTwo-thirds of working-age families had a retirement plan last year, a smaller proportion than in 2016. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eMany economists fear that families who were struggling financially before Covid-19 will come out of the pandemic in worse shape. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eA company is going public soon. We’ll give you three hints, and you have to guess the company we’re describing. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003col\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIt raked in $500 million in revenue last year.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIt derived \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/09/28/investing/bts-big-hit-entertainment-ipo/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e97% of that revenue\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e from just seven people \u003cimg src=\"https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/purple-heart_1f49c.png\" width=\"18\" style=\"max-width:18px\" alt=\"\"\u003e.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIt’s successfully made the jump from Korea into Western culture.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ol\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIf you answered “Big Hit Entertainment, the Korean record label of K-pop boy band BTS,” then you must have a very specific Spotify history.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBig Hit’s upcoming public offering is already the biggest South Korean stock market listing in the last three years. And 98% of the ~1,420 institutional investors participating in the offering have said they would pay the \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-bts-big-hit-ipo/investors-swamp-ipo-for-k-pop-band-bts-management-label-prices-at-top-of-range-idUSKBN26J09S?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etop-range IPO price\u003c/a\u003e or higher.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAt $115/share, the company would be valued at $4.1 billion, turning all seven members of BTS, who are shareholders in Big Hit, into multimillionaires.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eA publicly traded company has never had as rabid a fanbase as BTS’s supporters, known as ARMY.
